text: Corneille Jean Fran√ßois Heymans (March 28, 1892 - July 18, 1968) was an Belgian doctor. He won the 1938 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his discoveries about how breathing is regulated. ==References== Category:1892 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Belgian Nobel Prize winners Category:Belgian physicians Category:Scientists from Ghent Category:Pharmacologists
